comment: I was an all As student until this class. It was her first semester as a professor and it showed. Changed grading last minute, took FOREVER to grade things, wouldn't respond to emails, etc. One time, a student had a mandatory family thing the same week we had a test, she told them that was unfortunate and gave them a 0. DONT TAKE HER!!!

What people have said below is factually correct. For those reading this in the future, it was her first semester of teaching so she will probably get better over time. I think timely grading and consistency over the terms of the syllabus would've eliminated most complaints. For those complaining about having little extra credit, get over yourself.
rating_tags: Group projects--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: Going into this final (30% of grade) unsure of what I need to get because she still hasn't graded project. Switched things up on my class last minute with attendance points (used to be bonus) and then switched it up right before break. You need the textbook because she doesn't teach stuff in class but will test you over the entire book.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Random attendance for extra credit turned into part of our grade because she didn't like that people weren't showing up, and exams receive practically zero coverage in class aside from clicking through ppt's. Then there is a 50 question cumulative final exam worth 30% of your grade. Pick someone else for your own good.

Passionate about what she teaches, but she's ridiculous, attendance was marked as "BONUS points" and then she switched to be part of our total grade right before Thanksgiving. She only takes Attendance when the classroom looks a little empty. Final is cumulative and 30% of our grades - will test you on things she didn't teach.

She's a working professional that the university hired to teach this class. She is not a good lecturer, but if you do the assignments, come to class for the attendance bonuses, and take advantage of the extra credit assignments, you can get an A. There is a group marketing project worth 30%, she is not super strict with grading.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Group projects--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: does not follow her syllabus whatsoever. Changes grading policies literally two weeks before thanksgiving break. Does not write her own exams, they are made and taken through Connect. Bad.

comment: Do not recommend taking her. She does not listen or want her students to succeed. Does not help us on the exam and tells us to study "everything." Practically had to beg her to give us bonus points, and when she did, it was very little. Doesn't stay true to her word in the syllabus and constantly changes the points. Randomly calls on people.

comment: Reading the textbook before class is pretty much necessary in order to do well on tests. Randomly takes attendance that weighs heavily on your grade. Very few extra credit opportunities. Puts extra credit questions on test for 2 points (equal to like 1 wrong question). She will not apply extra credit if it makes the grade over a 100.

Exams are in-person, lockdown with camera, and cover about 5 chapters each. Exam is cumulative. Expected to read textbook BEFORE class, and anything in there is considered fair game for the exam. Attendance can help with bonus points, and there are extra credit opportunities.
